modules.description: This module defines operations for manipulating byte buffers, including concatenation, conversion to and from strings and Cstructs, and element-wise access. It supports working with byte sequences in a structured way, enabling precise handling of binary data. Use cases include parsing and serializing cryptographic data, managing binary protocols, and interfacing with low-level network or storage systems.

Implements ED25519 cryptographic operations including public key derivation, signature generation, and signature verification. Works with raw 32-byte secret keys, public keys, and arbitrary-length messages. Used to sign and verify data integrity in ProScript applications requiring secure authentication and tamper-proof message exchange.

This module implements the ED25519 digital signature algorithm for signing and verifying messages. It operates on 32-byte secret keys, public keys, and signatures, providing functions to derive public keys from secret keys, generate signatures, and validate signatures against messages and public keys. It is used in scenarios requiring secure, high-performance digital signatures, such as authenticating data or verifying software updates.

This module handles conversions between byte values and their hexadecimal representations. It provides functions to convert a byte to a two-character hexadecimal buffer, and to parse fixed-length hexadecimal strings into byte arrays of 32 or 12 bytes. It is used to encode and decode binary data for transmission or storage in contexts requiring hexadecimal formatting.

This module implements core cryptographic operations including AES-GCM encryption and decryption, SHA-256 and SHA-512 hashing, HMAC-SHA256 authentication, and X25519 key exchange. It works with byte buffers represented as Crypto.t values, handling key derivation, secure message encryption with authentication, and digital signature support through the ED25519 submodule. Concrete use cases include securing communications, generating cryptographic digests for data integrity, and producing authenticated encryption for sensitive payloads.

This module implements core cryptographic operations including AES-GCM encryption and decryption, SHA-256 and SHA-512 hashing, HMAC-SHA-256 authentication, and X25519 key exchange. It works with a base type `t` representing binary data, along with structured types for encrypted and decrypted AES results. Concrete use cases include securing communications with authenticated encryption, generating cryptographic digests, producing random byte sequences, and performing elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman key derivation.

This module implements ED25519 cryptographic operations, including key pair generation, signature creation, and signature verification. It works with 32-byte raw secret and public keys, and arbitrary-length messages. Concrete use cases include securing communications, authenticating data, and verifying digital signatures in distributed systems.

This module handles conversions between byte values and their hexadecimal representations. It provides functions to convert a single byte to a 2-byte hexadecimal buffer, and to convert fixed-length hexadecimal strings (64 or 24 characters) into 32-byte or 12-byte arrays, respectively. These operations are useful when decoding cryptographic hashes or binary data from hexadecimal strings.

This module defines the interface for cryptographic operations used in verified ProScript code, including Ed25519 digital signatures and general cryptographic primitives. It works with abstract data types representing keys, signatures, and encoded data, enabling tasks such as verifying script signatures and handling secure data encoding in a MirageOS-based environment. Child modules provide concrete implementations for byte buffer manipulation, ED25519 operations, hexadecimal encoding, and core cryptographic functions like AES-GCM, SHA hashing, and X25519 key exchange. These components together support secure communication, data integrity verification, and cryptographic encoding operations required by ProScript applications.
